intro: Gymnadenia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered cowslip, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are linear and arranged in a basal rosette, and the flowers are borne on slender, erect stems. Gymnadenia pauciflora is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
